body_content.explanation: the group of people who officially control a country:
examples: The government is/are expected to announce its/their tax proposals today.
The minister has announced that there will be no change in government policy.
Senior government officials will be attending a meeting tomorrow.
Theatre companies are very concerned about cuts in government grants to the arts.
A government enquiry has been launched.

body_content.explanation: the system used for controlling a country, city, or group of people:
examples: The 1990s saw a shift to democratic government in Eastern Europe.
What this state needs is really strong government.

body_content.explanation: the activities involved in controlling a country, city, group of people, etc.:
examples: The party that was elected to power has no experience of government.
The party was in government (= controlled the country) for four years in the 1960s.
This is the decision of Her Majesty's Government.
